interviewer_dialogue: Hi, this is Interviewer, the landlord.

patient_dialogue: Hi, this is Patient [ph?], your tenant. I'm calling to let you know that I have called you twice already to let you know I have a leak and you still haven't came to fix it.
interviewer_dialogue: Oh, yeah, I'm sorry I haven't had enough time to get over to fix it yet. I've just been very busy.

patient_dialogue: Okay, when do you think you'll be able to come?
interviewer_dialogue: Uh.. it might take about a week, or maybe even two weeks, before I'll have time to get over there.

patient_dialogue: I cannot keep waiting with my leak.
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. have you done anything about the problem so far?

patient_dialogue: Yes, I put a bucket under it.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay. Has that been working at all?

patient_dialogue: No, I have to keep changing it.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay. Uhm.. well, yeah, like I said, uhm.. I don't really know what I can do about the problem right now.

patient_dialogue: Okay, so I'm not going to know what to do about the rent either then.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay, uhm.. uh.. I mean, I have a lot of other tenants with problems that are just ahead of yours right now uhm..
Uhm.. well, I mean, like I- I have a list of things to do and you're on the list, but uh.. there's just other problems right now I have to take care of that uhm.. seem more serious than leaks, so.

patient_dialogue: No, to me this is a very serious situation.
interviewer_dialogue: Uh.. it really didn't sound that bad the last time you called.

patient_dialogue: Yeah, but it has gotten worse.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay, uhm.. well, I do all the repairs myself for the whole building, uhm.. so I've just been really backed up.

patient_dialogue: So if you do the repairs for everybody else that's home do you think you can come and check the leak while you're here already?
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. I mean, you're on my list, uhm.. and I will get there when I get there I guess. It might take me a week, or maybe even two, before I can get over there to actually fix it, so.

patient_dialogue: <laughs> No, uh.. I don't know what to say because in real life I would have told him--
interviewer_dialogue: Go ahead, it's just like, yeah.
Uhm.. okay, uhm.. I mean, I understand it's a serious problem, uhm.. but, yeah, uhm.. I can do what I can. Uhm.. if it's got, you said it has gotten worse, right?
Okay, uhm.. well, I can uhm.. see if I can move you up on the list and see if I can get there within the week. Does that sound okay?
So how- how quickly do you need this fixed would you say?

patient_dialogue: I need this done today. I called you a week ago and you told me a week and it has been a week already. I need this done today.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay, uhm.. yeah, I understand. Uhm.. you're right. Uh, so I'll get over there as soon as I can. Uh.. sometime today or even tomorrow.

patient_dialogue: Okay, thank you so much. Have a good day.
